get.description: Full open api spec in JSON format. (See https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/README.md)
get.summary: Returns the open api spec document.

200.description: The request was successful. Successful responses will return a stream of individual JSON Tweet payloads.

get.description: Streams a deterministic 1% of public tweets.
get.summary: Streams a deterministic 1% of public tweets.

parameters.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Tweets. Up to 1024 characters.
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp from which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute).
parameters.name: start_time

parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute).
parameters.name: end_time

parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.
parameters.name: since_id

parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID.
parameters.name: until_id

parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to be returned by a request.
parameters.name: max_results

parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified.
parameters.name: next_token

parameters.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.
parameters.name: expansions

parameters.description: A comma separated list of Tweet fields to display.
parameters.name: tweet.fields

parameters.description: A comma separated list of User fields to display.
parameters.name: user.fields

parameters.description: A comma separated list of Media fields to display.
parameters.name: media.fields

parameters.description: A comma separated list of Place fields to display.
parameters.name: place.fields

parameters.description: A comma separated list of Poll fields to display.
parameters.name: poll.fields

newest_id.description: Most recent Tweet Id returned by search query

next_token.description: This value is used to get the next 'page' of results by providing it to the next_token parameter.

oldest_id.description: Oldest Tweet Id returned by search query

get.description: Returns Tweets that match a search query.
get.summary: Returns Tweets that match a search query.

parameters.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Tweets. Up to 512 characters.
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp (from most recent 7 days) from which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute).
parameters.name: start_time

parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute).
parameters.name: end_time

parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.
parameters.name: since_id

parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID.
parameters.name: until_id

parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to be returned by a request.
parameters.name: max_results

parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified.
parameters.name: next_token

get.description: Streams tweets matching a user's active rule set.
get.summary: Streams tweets matching a user's active rule set.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Rule IDs.
parameters.name: ids

get.description: Returns rules from a user's active rule set. Users can fetch all of their rules or a subset, specified by the provided rule ids.
get.summary: Returns rules from a user's active rule set.

parameters.description: Dry Run can be used with both the add and delete action, with the expected result given, but without actually taking any action in the system (meaning the end state will always be as it was when the request was submitted). This is particularly useful to validate rule changes.
parameters.name: dry_run

post.description: Add or delete rules from a user's active rule set. Users can provide unique, optionally tagged rules to add. Users can delete their entire rule set or a subset specified by rule ids or values.
post.summary: Add or delete rules from a user's active rule set.

put.description: Tweet ID in the path is that of the reply to hide or unhide.

CashtagFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a Cashtag, and its start and end position within the text.

ClientForbiddenProblem.description: A problem that indicates your client is forbidden from making this request.

ConnectionExceptionProblem.description: A problem that indicates something is wrong with the connection

ContextAnnotation.description: Annotation inferred from the tweet text.

ContextAnnotationDomainFields.description: Represents the data for the context annotation domain.

description.description: Description of the context annotation domain.

id.description: The unique id for a context annotation domain.

name.description: Name of the context annotation domain.

ContextAnnotationEntityFields.description: Represents the data for the context annotation entity.

description.description: Description of the context annotation entity.

id.description: The unique id for a context annotation entity.

name.description: Name of the context annotation entity.

DisallowedResourceProblem.description: A problem that indicates that the resource requested violates the precepts of this API.

DuplicateRuleProblem.description: The rule you have submitted is a duplicate.

EntityIndices.description: Represent a boundary range (start and end index) for a recognized entity (for example a hashtag or a mention). `start` must be smaller than `end`.

end.description: Index (zero-based) at which position this entity ends.

start.description: Index (zero-based) at which position this entity starts.

FieldUnauthorizedProblem.description: A problem that indicates that you are not allowed to see a particular field on a Tweet, User, etc.

FilteredStreamingTweet.description: A tweet or error that can be returned by the streaming tweet API

GenericProblem.description: A generic problem with no additional information beyond that provided by the HTTP status code.

HashtagFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a Hashtag, and its start and end position within the text.

InvalidRequestProblem.description: A problem that indicates this request is invalid.

InvalidRuleProblem.description: The rule you have submitted is invalid.

MediaHeight.description: The height of the media in pixels

MediaKey.description: The Media Key identifier for this attachment.

MediaWidth.description: The width of the media in pixels

MentionFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a User mention, and its start and end position within the text.

OperationalDisconnectProblem.description: You have been disconnected for operational reasons.

name.description: The human readable name of this place.

Poll.description: Represent a Poll attached to a Tweet

PollOption.description: Describes a choice in a Poll object.

label.description: The text of a poll choice.

position.description: Position of this choice in the poll.

votes.description: Number of users who voted for this choice.

Problem.description: An HTTP Problem Details object, as defined in IETF RFC 7807 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807).

ReplySettings.description: Shows who can reply a Tweet. Fields returned are everyone, mentioned_users, and following.

value.description: Value will match the schema of the field.

ResourceNotFoundProblem.description: A problem that indicates that a given Tweet, User, etc. does not exist.

ResourceUnauthorizedProblem.description: A problem that indicates you are not allowed to see a particular Tweet, User, etc.

RuleTag.description: A tag meant for the labeling of user provided rules.

RuleValue.description: The filterlang value of the rule.

RulesCapProblem.description: You have exceeded the maximum number of rules.

StreamingTweet.description: A tweet or error that can be returned by the streaming tweet API.

example.text: Some great insight into the human condition.

attachments.description: Specifies the type of attachments (if any) present in this Tweet.

media_keys.description: A list of Media Keys for each one of the media attachments (if media are attached).

poll_ids.description: A list of poll IDs (if polls are attached).

geo.description: The location tagged on the Tweet, if the user provided one.

lang.description: Language of the Tweet, if detected by Twitter. Returned as a BCP47 language tag.

non_public_metrics.description: Nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

impression_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.

organic_metrics.description: Organic nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

impression_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.

like_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.

reply_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

possibly_sensitive.description: Indicates if this Tweet contains URLs marked as sensitive, for example content suitable for mature audiences.

promoted_metrics.description: Promoted nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

impression_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.

like_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.

reply_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

public_metrics.description: Engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

like_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.

quote_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been quoted.

reply_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

referenced_tweets.description: A list of Tweets this Tweet refers to. For example, if the parent Tweet is a Retweet, a Quoted Tweet or a Reply, it will include the related Tweet referenced to by its parent.

source.description: The name of the app the user Tweeted from.

TweetID.description: Unique identifier of this Tweet. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.

newest_id.description: The ID of the newest Tweet in the response.

next_token.description: The next cursor provided by the response.

oldest_id.description: The ID of the oldest Tweet in the response.

previous_token.description: The previous cursor provided by the response.

result_count.description: Number of results returned in the response.

newest_id.description: Most recent Tweet Id returned by search query

next_token.description: This value is used to get the next 'page' of results by providing it to the next_token parameter.

oldest_id.description: Oldest Tweet Id returned by search query

copyright.description: Indicates if the content is being withheld for on the basis of copyright infringement.

country_codes.description: Provides a list of countries where this content is not available.

scope.description: Indicates whether the content being withheld is the `tweet` or a `user`.

URLFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a URL.

description.description: Description of the URL landing page.

display_url.description: The URL as displayed in the Twitter client.

title.description: Title of the page the URL points to.

URLImage.description: Represent the information for the URL image

UnsupportedAuthenticationProblem.description: A problem that indicates that the authentication used is not supported.

UrlEntity.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a URL, and its start and end position within the text.

UsageCapExceededProblem.description: A problem that indicates that a usage cap has been exceeded.

description.description: The text of this user's profile description (also known as bio), if the user provided one.

entities.description: A list of metadata found in the user's profile description.

url.description: Expanded details for the URL specified in the user's profile, with start and end indices.

location.description: The location specified in the user's profile, if the user provided one. As this is a freeform value, it may not indicate a valid location, but it may be fuzzily evaluated when performing searches with location queries.

name.description: The friendly name of this user, as shown on their profile.

profile_image_url.description: The URL to the profile image for this user.

protected.description: Indicates if this user has chosen to protect their Tweets (in other words, if this user's Tweets are private).

public_metrics.description: A list of metrics for this user

followers_count.description: Number of users who are following this user.

following_count.description: Number of users this user is following.

listed_count.description: The number of lists that include this user.

tweet_count.description: The number of Tweets (including Retweets) posted by this user.

url.description: The URL specified in the user's profile.

verified.description: Indicate if this user is a verified Twitter User.

UserID.description: Unique identifier of this User. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.

UserName.description: The Twitter handle (screen name) of this user.

country_codes.description: Provides a list of countries where this content is not available.

scope.description: Indicates that the content being withheld is a `user`.

non_public_metrics.description: Nonpublic engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

playback_0_count.description: Number of users who made it through 0% of the video.

playback_100_count.description: Number of users who made it through 100% of the video.

playback_25_count.description: Number of users who made it through 25% of the video.

playback_50_count.description: Number of users who made it through 50% of the video.

playback_75_count.description: Number of users who made it through 75% of the video.

organic_metrics.description: Organic nonpublic engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

playback_0_count.description: Number of users who made it through 0% of the video.

playback_100_count.description: Number of users who made it through 100% of the video.

playback_25_count.description: Number of users who made it through 25% of the video.

playback_50_count.description: Number of users who made it through 50% of the video.

playback_75_count.description: Number of users who made it through 75% of the video.

view_count.description: Number of times this video has been viewed.

promoted_metrics.description: Promoted nonpublic engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

playback_0_count.description: Number of users who made it through 0% of the video.

playback_100_count.description: Number of users who made it through 100% of the video.

playback_25_count.description: Number of users who made it through 25% of the video.

playback_50_count.description: Number of users who made it through 50% of the video.

playback_75_count.description: Number of users who made it through 75% of the video.

view_count.description: Number of times this video has been viewed.

public_metrics.description: Engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

view_count.description: Number of times this video has been viewed.

tags.description: Miscellaneous endpoints for general API functionality
tags.name: General

EndTimeRequestParameter.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The latest UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. The until_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified.
EndTimeRequestParameter.name: end_time

MediaFieldsParameter.description: A comma separated list of Media fields to display.
MediaFieldsParameter.name: media.fields

PaginationTokenRequestParameter.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results.
PaginationTokenRequestParameter.name: pagination_token

PlaceFieldsParameter.description: A comma separated list of Place fields to display.
PlaceFieldsParameter.name: place.fields

PollFieldsParameter.description: A comma separated list of Poll fields to display.
PollFieldsParameter.name: poll.fields

SinceIdRequestParameter.description: The minimum Tweet ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over start_time if both are specified.
SinceIdRequestParameter.name: since_id

StartTimeRequestParameter.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The earliest UTC timestamp from which the mentions will be provided. The since_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified.
StartTimeRequestParameter.name: start_time

TweetExpansionsParameter.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.
TweetExpansionsParameter.name: expansions

TweetFieldsParameter.description: A comma separated list of Tweet fields to display.
TweetFieldsParameter.name: tweet.fields

TweetTypeExcludesRequestParameter.description: The set of entities to exclude (e.g. 'replies' or 'retweets')
TweetTypeExcludesRequestParameter.name: exclude

UntilIdRequestParameter.description: The maximum Tweet ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over end_time if both are specified.
UntilIdRequestParameter.name: until_id

UserExpansionsParameter.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.
UserExpansionsParameter.name: expansions

UserFieldsParameter.description: A comma separated list of User fields to display.
UserFieldsParameter.name: user.fields
